info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 20 at 6:08PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Cabarrus, eastern Lincoln, southeastern Iredell, northwestern Mecklenburg, southwestern Rowan and northeastern Gaston Counties through 645 PM EDT... At 608 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles west of Huntersville, or 4 miles southwest of Ramsey Creek Park, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Huntersville, Kannapolis, Cornelius, Mooresville, Davidson, Enochville, Westport, Lake Norman, Charlotte Motor Speedway and Coddle Creek Reservoir. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
